name: Agent Team Registry
title: Agent Team Registry
description: Central registry of all agents with their capabilities, DIDs, and UAL communication protocols

metadata.purpose: Enable formal agent-to-agent communication using Universal Agent Language (UAL)

agents.name: Test Conductor
agents.description: Proactive test orchestration agent with parallelization, coverage, and regression detection

agents.name: Integrity Guardian
agents.description: Layer 0 guardian ensuring axiom compliance, purpose alignment, and conflict resolution

agents.name: Knowledge Extender
agents.description: Intelligent knowledge extension agent for capturing patterns and updating knowledge base

agents.name: Workflow Architect
agents.description: Design, create, and orchestrate workflows for complex multi-step tasks

agents.name: Template Generator
agents.description: Generate code and document templates for target projects

agents.name: System Steward
agents.description: Unified agent for repository governance, system maintenance, and documentation quality

agents.name: Registry Clerk
agents.description: Specialized agent for automating registration tasks, maintaining registries, and updating dependency graphs

agents.name: Sentiment Analyst
agents.description: Analyzes market sentiment from news, financial reports, and social sources

agents.name: Fundamental Analyst
agents.description: Performs deep fundamental valuation using factor models and DCF

agents.name: Technician Analyst
agents.description: Advanced technical analyst using clustering and vectorized momentum patterns

patterns.description: Store learned patterns in knowledge base

axiom_context.justification: Running tests for user benefit (A1), with transparent parameters (A2)
Seeking guidance for user benefit (A1), transparent about dilemma (A2), avoiding harmful decisions (A4)
Capturing pattern for future benefit (A1), enabling learning (A10)

trust_tier_enforcement_usage.description: Check agent.trust_tier before delegation. Enforce trust tier requirements based on delegation target

best_practices: Validate implementation against domain requirements
Document the pattern usage and rationale in code
Assign unique DIDs to all agents - use consistent naming scheme (did:agent:{agent-id}) for discoverability
Document agent capabilities explicitly - list all skills, knowledge, and MCP tools each agent can access
Define delegation rules with timeouts - set appropriate timeout_ms based on operation complexity (10s for simple, 60s+ for complex)
Use UAL performatives correctly - REQUEST for actions, QUERY for information, INFORM for notifications, CONFIRM for verification
Include axiom context in all UAL messages - declare which axioms the message aligns with and provide justification
Maintain delegation depth limits - enforce max_delegation_depth to prevent infinite delegation chains
Register agents before use - ensure agent exists in registry before allowing delegation to prevent runtime errors
Version agent definitions - track changes to agent capabilities and delegation patterns for compatibility

anti_patterns.name: Circular Delegation Chain
anti_patterns.problem: Agent A delegates to B, B delegates to C, C delegates back to A, creating infinite loop
anti_patterns.fix: Enforce max_delegation_depth. Track delegation path in state. Detect cycles and escalate to integrity-guardian

anti_patterns.name: Missing Axiom Context
anti_patterns.problem: UAL messages sent without axiom_context, violating transparency requirements and making verification impossible
anti_patterns.fix: Require axiom_context in all UAL message templates. Validate context presence before message routing

anti_patterns.name: Capability Mismatch
anti_patterns.problem: Agent delegates task requiring skill X to agent that doesn't have skill X, causing runtime failure
anti_patterns.fix: Validate agent capabilities match delegation requirements. Check skill availability before delegation

anti_patterns.name: Orphaned Agent References
anti_patterns.problem: Delegation rules reference agents not in registry, or agents reference non-existent delegation targets
anti_patterns.fix: Validate all agent_id references resolve to registered agents. Use schema validation on registry updates

anti_patterns.name: Timeout Without Fallback
anti_patterns.problem: Delegation times out but no fallback strategy defined, leaving workflow stuck
anti_patterns.fix: Define escalation_on_failure behavior. Specify fallback agents or escalation paths for all delegations

axiomAlignment.A1_verifiability: All patterns include verifiable examples and test approaches
axiomAlignment.A2_user_primacy: Patterns prioritize user needs and practical outcomes
axiomAlignment.A3_transparency: Pattern selection rationale is clearly documented
axiomAlignment.A4_non_harm: Patterns include safety considerations and error handling
axiomAlignment.A5_consistency: Patterns follow established conventions and standards
